item.title: [FLINK-26192] PulsarOrderedSourceReaderTest fails with exit code 255

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This looked to me the test VM crashed, let's keep observing it for a while, if it does not happen again for 1 month, can we close it ?
Given the amount of issues that pulsar is causing on CI, I'd say no to that.
The PulsarEmbeddedRuntime has a codepath for shutting down the JVM, see #startPulsarService.
Which, to emphasize, is a really bad idea and shouldn't happen.
The crazy thing is that PulsarService even explicitly offers a constructor for testing purposes that doesn't do that.
Got it, I'll bring this issue up with my team tomorrow~ Thanks for your advice ~ We'll try our best to solve it soon.
Just for documentation purposes: This build also failed with an exit code 255.
And another one where the failure appears in PulsarWriterTest
